metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43337 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
SchedMD Slurm 21.08.* before 21.08.4 has Incorrect Access Control. On sitesusing the new AccountingStoreFlags=job_script and/or job_env options, theaccess control rules in SlurmDBD may permit users to request job scriptsand environment files to which they should not have access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43337` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
libpam-slurm-adopt - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
libpmi0 - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
libpmi2-0 - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
libslurm-perl - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
libslurm37 - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
libslurmdb-perl - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurm-client - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurm-client-emulator - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurm-wlm - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurm-wlm-emulator - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurm-wlm-torque - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurmctld - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurmd - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurmdbd - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
slurmrestd - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
sview - 21.08.5-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-wlm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '21.08.5-2ubuntu1').
